title: IB Physics - Energy Production
subject: physics
description: Quiz covering energy sources, thermal energy transfer, power generation, and greenhouse effect for IB Physics
author: OpenNotes

questions.question: The efficiency of a thermal power station is typically:
questions.explanation: Typical coal/gas power stations have efficiencies of 30-40% due to heat losses (Carnot efficiency limits).

questions.question: The Stefan-Boltzmann law states that the total power radiated by a black body is:
questions.explanation: $P = \sigma A T^4$ where $\sigma = 5.67 \times 10^{-8}$ W m⁻² K⁻⁴ is the Stefan-Boltzmann constant.

questions.question: Which of the following is the main greenhouse gas responsible for the enhanced greenhouse effect?
questions.explanation: $CO_2$ is the primary anthropogenic greenhouse gas. Its increase from burning fossil fuels is the main driver of enhanced greenhouse effect.

questions.question: A solar panel of area $2 \text{ m}^2$ receives solar radiation at $800 \text{ W m}^{-2}$ and has 20% efficiency. Calculate the power output in watts.
questions.explanation: Power input $= 800 \times 2 = 1600$ W. Power output $= 0.20 \times 1600 = 320$ W

questions.question: Wien's displacement law states that $\lambda_{\text{max}} T = b$ where $b = 2.9 \times 10^{-3}$ m K. The Sun's surface temperature is $\sim 5800$ K. The peak wavelength is:
questions.explanation: $\lambda_{\text{max}} = \frac{2.9 \times 10^{-3}}{5800} = 5.0 \times 10^{-7}$ m $= 500$ nm, which is in the visible spectrum (green).

questions.question: Which energy source has the highest energy density (energy per unit mass)?
questions.explanation: Nuclear fuel has energy density of ~$8 \times 10^{13}$ J/kg, compared to coal ~$3 \times 10^7$ J/kg. Nuclear is about a million times more energy-dense.

questions.question: The albedo of a surface is defined as:
options: The ratio of reflected to incident radiation
questions.explanation: Albedo = $\frac{\text{power reflected}}{\text{power incident}}$. Ice has high albedo (~0.8), oceans have low albedo (~0.06).

questions.question: A hydroelectric dam of height $h = 50$ m has water flowing at a rate of $100 \text{ kg s}^{-1}$. The maximum power output is ($g = 10 \text{ m s}^{-2}$):
The greenhouse effect works because greenhouse gases:
options: Absorb and re-emit infrared radiation from Earth's surface
Absorb incoming visible radiation from the Sun
questions.explanation: Greenhouse gases are transparent to visible light but absorb infrared radiation emitted by Earth's surface, re-emitting it in all directions including back toward the surface.
